pymongohelper package#

Submodules#

pymongohelper.typing module#

Typing module of pymongohelper

Module contents#

Helper module makes pymongo more clean.

class pymongohelper.AsyncBaseHelper#

Bases: ABC, Generic[CollectionType]

Base async helper class for pymongo clients.

This class do nothing, just a template help you design db clients.

Usage:

foo_collection = database.get_collection("foo")

class AsyncMongoReader(AsyncBaseHelper[AgnosticCollection]):
    _collection = foo_collection

    async def __call__(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
        # do some query here
        res = await self._collection.find_one()
        return res

async with AsyncMongoReader() as reader:
    data = await reader()
class pymongohelper.AsyncMongoHelper(collection: CollectionType)#

Bases: AsyncBaseHelper[CollectionType]

Helper async class with simple constructor method.

Usage:

foo_collection = database.get_collection("foo")

class MongoReader(AsyncMongoHelper[AgnosticCollection]):
    async def __call__(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
        # do some query here
        res = await self._collection.find_one()
        return res

async with MongoReader(foo_collection) as reader:
    data = await reader()

Constructor method.

Parameters:

collection (CollectionType) – The collection to use.

class pymongohelper.BaseHelper#

Bases: ABC, Generic[CollectionType]

Base helper class for pymongo clients.

This class do nothing, just a template help you design db clients.

Usage:

foo_collection = database.get_collection("foo")

class MongoReader(BaseHelper[Collection[DocumentType]]):
    _collection = foo_collection

    def __call__(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
        # do some query here
        res = self._collection.find_one()
        return res

with MongoReader() as reader:
    data = reader()
class pymongohelper.PyMongoHelper(collection: CollectionType)#

Bases: BaseHelper[CollectionType]

Helper class with simple constructor method.

Usage:

foo_collection = database.get_collection("foo")

class MongoReader(PyMongoHelper[Collection[DocumentType]]):
    def __call__(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
        # do some query here
        res = self._collection.find_one()
        return res

with MongoReader(foo_collection) as reader:
    data = reader()

Constructor method.

Parameters:

collection (CollectionType) – The collection to use.

class pymongohelper.UseCollectionDecorator(collection: CollectionType)#

Bases: Generic[CollectionType]

Decorator class to add collection into sub class of BaseHelper or AsyncBaseHelper.

Usage:

foo_collection = database.get_collection("foo")
use_foo_collection = UseCollectionDecorator(foo_collection)

# this will set ``TestHelper._collection`` as ``foo_collection``
@use_foo_collection
class TestHelper(BaseHelper):

    def __call__(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
        result = self._collection.find_one()
        return result

Constructor method.

Parameters:

collection (CollectionType) – The collection to use.
